result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A Gruber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:28 A.M. Defendant Thomas A Gruber in court, in custody with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1 dismissed, read in, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, 6 months jail w/Huber, forthwith, $518.00 costs, provide DNA Sample, firearms restriction, AODA and comply, 78 days sentence credit, ineligible for purchase/usage of body armour, 9:54 A.M.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Atty Yaskal calls Witness Officer Adam Malchow, Portage Police Dept., sworn, testimony taken, 9:23 A.M. Return date scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Thomas A Gruber in court, in custody by video with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $3,000.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, no contact w/L.L.F. or her residence, no time limit waiver,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
